intro: Leandra pectinata, commonly known as the silky leandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are large, ovate, and covered in a fine, silky hair, giving it a distinctive appearance. Leandra pectinata thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests.
